page.title: 04EDUCATION IN BARR
page.content: Barr Primary School, being one of several small rural schools in the Carrick area, comprises of two class-rooms,G.P.room,staff-room and toilets.The pupils are divided into primaries 1-3 and 4-7.Most of the twenty-six pupils are from outlying farms and are transported to and from school by the school taxis which are based in the village.During the winter many farm roads are blocked with snow and pupils are often absent for weeks at a time until the snow plough can clear the roads.All pupils take school lunches(58 pence per day)which are cooked in the school's kitchen by the cook who lives in the village.Before attending the village school, pre-school children can attend the village playgroup.When pupils reach the age of eleven they transfer to Girvan Academy(13km.from Barr).
